svcproc.title: GENERAL INFORMATION
svcproc.para: Air brake equipment on International vehicles provides a means of controlling brakes through a medium of compressed air. The air system consists of various components required to maintain a supply of air, direct the flow of air and convert the energy of compressed air into mechanical force to apply the brakes. Different types and sizes of devices are used on different types of vehicles to meet operating requirements.

The law has special requirements for emergency performance, which means if air loss occurs on any one of a vehicle's axles, the chassis must demonstrate stopping capability upon activation of the service brake control.
